course.name: Environmental Science
course.description: This course introduces students to the general concepts of environment, natural resources, and sustainable development. The topics include pressing global, regional and local environmental changes; life-supporting systems of our planet; biodiversity and its conservation; atmosphere, water resources, and their pollutions; solid and hazardous waste management; environmental health and sustainable development. Throughout the course, students will gain a sufficient background and a better understanding of the root-causes of the upfront environmental issues. They will also become more aware of their role, as citizens, in environmental protection and sustainable development.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ice Ko explains quite clearly, and would ask students to participate sometimes (i.e. answering her questions). However,  she would talk about stuff outside lecture notes (like her experiences) and drag the lecture time. Keep in mind that Dr. Ice Ko would add extra materials during lecture sessions that you cannot find in the lecture notes uploaded in Canvas, so be sure to attend lectures and/or watch the zoom recording.

Dr. Cindy Lam is good in explaining the course material, and is better in staying focused to lectures. She will also give some hands-on demonstrations depending on which material (i.e. demonstrating the biomass anode/cathode).

Both are pretty good overall, and most lectures have IPRS sessions.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko:
Not as bad as other review said. Her teaching is not that bad. Her notes provide info, pictures and sometimes some news clips for our reference in the notes. Some of the slides will not be inserted in the ppt she gave us before the lecture and u need to focus during the lectures to copy those slides down. (Or rewatch the zoom recordings afterwards like me if u are having remote classes) She will tell us that some tables or additional info are only for reference which will not be test in the exam. However she REALLY loves to talk about stuff that are off topic like how her University life be and ask us some cringe questions. She also loves to talk about additional info or news clips for VERY LONG. (And most of them are not really useful too) Just ignore these part and focus on the notes will make ur life easier.

Cynthia Yau:
Personally I like her teaching more than Ice Ko. Her notes also clearly state most of the useful info while some of them require u to write it down yourself during the lectures. The pictures, tables and news clips she put in her notes are quite interesting and worth discussing. Those news clips, her questions and even her personal experiences that she shared with us are much more relevant to the context than what Ice Ko shared with us. Nevertheless, I think she is not good at tech and online teaching stuff. The first lesson she sent out the zoom link very late, even pass the starting time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got a B+ overall.

As most of the context in this lecture are covered in my secondary school already, I didn’t study very much or need to work very very hard on the course to got a B+. If u didn’t study Biology or Ecology before, u may need to work harder to clear ur concepts and revise for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very heavy workload.
Originally, Ice Ko said there will be one midterm(testing her notes) and one final(testing Yau’s note). Till 2 weeks before the mid term, she cancelled the midterm exam and change it into 10% a ppt assignment and 90% final(testing hers and Yau’s note together). The pressure is very high cause the weighting of final is high.
ppt assignment: (10%)
We are required to choose one of the terrestrial biome and make a 7 slide ppt (with apa form citations) according to her reference ppt given. Not very hard or having heavy workload. But many of us worried about the format (eg font size, colour, pictures and citations format) than our context because Ice Ko gave us quite a lot restrictions on format. (eg all font size must not be below 24). I used around a day and a half to finish it and got 7/10.
p1: cover
p2: main characteristics
p3-4: biodiversity
p5: major human impact
p6: conservation
p7: reference

Finial exam: (90%)
The main problem is testing all 16 topics at the same time and the weighting is very high therefore make me quite worrying. But if u focus in the lectures and had made notes during the lectures, the workload will not be heavy. I used a few days to rewatch most of the lecture zoom recordings and marked some notes  for the exam. The final exam is open book online exam. Online format ppt, lecture notes and notes  and even google are allowed. Most of them are in the notes and quite of them can be found in google. 100 minutes are given for 100 mc. The time is very tight I finished the exam just before time up. Although google and notes are allowed, u cant check for every question otherwise there will not be enough time.
Forgot the actual mark of the final but above mean (and the mean is quite high to as most of the questions are common sense and can google.)
